textPlain: > If lightweight cryptography was a good idea, we’d just call it “cryptography.”https://x.com/matthew_d_green/status/1948476801824485606

They chose Ascon which is a good family of cryptographic functions if you don't have hardware acceleration for AES or the CPU resources for chacha20 which is the intention of the standard. The security is 128-bits.<https://ascon.isec.tugraz.at/specification.html>

This is pretty cool. But IOT tends to fail hard on key agreement. And nothing here solves that. This seems to pretty much require a pre installed key, otherwise the overhead of securely installing a key would probably nullify the advantage of this encryption.
